title: Gardner’s brilliant hundred takes Australia back to the top
byline: Ash Gardner’s blistering unbeaten century helped Australia to a stunning six-wicket win over England at the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Technical fault delays mail train from Moratuwa to KKS
byline: Passengers on the mail train from Moratuwa to Kankesanthurai (KKS) experienced significant delays this evening after the train came to a halt between Dematagoda and Kelaniya stations due to a technical fault.

title: Allow people to consume liquor if you want high tax revenue: MP
byline: The government should enable the people to consume liquor in order to meet the desired tax revenue targets, opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake told Parliament today.

title: Weligama PS shooting a political killing: Madduma Bandara
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) management committee which met today approved a resolution to call for a free and fair investigation into the killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Paris to Jaffna – Young man travels 10,000 kilometres from France to Jaffna by bicycle
byline: A young man who travelled approximately 10,000 kilometres across about 13 countries from France by bicycle arrived in Jaffna this afternoon.

title: New Korean language exam centre opens in Talahena
byline: A state-of-the-art Korean Language Examination Centre equipped with Ubiquitous-based Test (UBT) technology was officially inaugurated today in Talahena, under the patronage of Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Arun Hemachandra.

title: Colombo stock market pauses near 23,000 level amid volatile trading
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) witnessed an eventful trading session today, characterized by heightened volatility and shifting investor sentiment.

title: Train services on upcountry line resume
byline: Railway services on the Upcountry Line resumed last night after being suspended for several days due to severe rain damage.

title: Green achievements spotlighted at Presidential Environment Awards 2025
byline: The prestigious “Presidential Environment Awards 2025” will be held today (23), at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH), under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: First political killing rocks Parliament
byline: The fatal shooting of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera has re-ignited public concern over whether the government and law enforcement authorities are taking the growing wave of gun violence seriously.

title: SL targets US $ 15bn digital economy with ‘super ROI’ strategy
byline: Sri Lanka is pursuing a strategy to generate ‘super return on investment (ROI)’ through a comprehensive digital transformation, aiming to build a US $ 15 billion digital economy, Chief Advisor to President on Digital Economy and Information and Communication Technology Agency Chairman Dr. Hans Wijesuriya said.

title: Credit card spend picks up in August with card debt rising Rs.2.9bn
byline: Sri Lankan credit card holders stepped up spending in August, reflecting rising consumer confidence and improving household incomes amid an expanding economy.

title: Kia Motors Lanka unveils 2026 Sorento Hybrid and EV5
byline: While adding two remarkable additions to the Kia family, Kia Motors Lanka yesterday launched the fifth-generation 2026 Kia Sorento Hybrid and Kia EV5, marking a new era of hybrid and electric mobility in Sri Lanka.

title: BIA expands self check-in facilities to enhance passenger experience
byline: Passengers departing from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) can now enjoy an improved and more flexible check-in experience, with the airport extending self-service facilities to streamline pre-departure procedures.

title: SJB MPs wear black in Parliament over Weligama PS Chairman killing
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MPs have come to Parliament today wearing black in protest over the Killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Drug traffickers should be hanged - Commissioner of Prisons
byline: Commissioner of Prisons and Media Spokesman Jagath Weerasinghe stressed that drug traffickers sentenced to death should be hanged.

title: ’Rotumba Amila’ suspected to be behind the Killing
byline: Dubai-based underworld leader Amila Sepala Ratnayake, alias “Rotumba Amila,” is suspected of orchestrating the assassination of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekara, a senior police officer said yesterday (22).

title: Weligama PS Chairman warned of threat, IGP ignored: Rehan
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Weligama Organiser Rehan Jayawickrama has accused the government of attempting to justify the recent killing of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman by labeling it an “underworld issue,” despite repeated warnings about threats to his life.

title: Flu wave sweeps through schools, children hit hard
byline: Health officials have raised the alarm over a dramatic rise in Influenza A and B infections sweeping through Sri Lanka with children among the worst affected.

title: Daily Mirror bags Silver Award at Presidential Environment Awards 2025
byline: Daily Mirror deputy Features Editor Kamanthi Wickramasinghe has been recognised with a Silver Award in the Media Sector – Individual Category (English Medium) at the Presidential Environment Awards 2025.

title: Delhi’s air has become toxic once again
byline: Every year, like clockwork, Delhi chokes. A thick, toxic haze settles over the city - stinging eyes, burning throats and sending air quality monitors into panic mode.

title: Preschools to follow single syllabus from 2026: PM
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said yesterday that one islandwide curriculum for all preschools will be introduced from 2026.

title: IOC to tell members not to host events in Indonesia
byline: Indonesia said it would not grant visas to the Israel team for the ongoing World Artistic Gymnastics Championships in Jakarta because of the country’s military offensive in Gaza.

title: Over 9,500 affected, four dead due to inclement weather
byline: A total of 9,542 people from 2,395 families across 12 districts have been affected by adverse weather conditions, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: AI powered threat detection system to safeguard cyber security: Deputy Minister
byline: The government has decided to use an AI powered threat detection system to safeguard state cloud services so that evolving threats could be known, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne told Parliament today.

title: Daily Mirror bags Merit Award at Presidential Environment Awards 2025
byline: Daily Mirror Deputy Web Editor Chaturanga Pradeep Samarawickrama has received a Merit Award in the Media Sector – Individual Category (English Medium) at the Presidential Environment Awards 2025, in recognition of his outstanding contribution to environmental awareness and communication.

title: Parliament to undergo special security search before budget
byline: Parliament will undergo a special security search ahead of the budget speech scheduled for November 7, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne told Parliament today.

title: Major probes to be carried out into land grabbing by politicians: Deputy Minister
byline: A major probe into land grabbing by politicians is set to be conducted, Deputy Minister of Lands Aravinda Senarath told Parliament today.

title: ’Rotumba Amila’ suspected to be behind killing of Weligama PS Chairman
byline: Dubai-based underworld leader Amila Sepala Ratnayake, alias “Rotumba Amila,” is suspected of orchestrating the assassination of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekara, a senior police officer said yesterday (22).

title: India’s next CJI calls for India-Sri Lanka collaboration to protect Indian ocean
byline: India’s next Chief Justice of India (CJI), Justice Surya Kant, has called for strengthened collaboration between India and Sri Lanka to safeguard the Indian Ocean, emphasising that environmental cooperation is not a matter of charity or diplomacy but a necessity for survival

title: Suspects of Weligama PS Chairman's killing to be arrested soon: Minister
byline: The suspects in the killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera will be arrested within the next few days, Minister Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Fake Bribery Commission officer arrested in Polonnaruwa
byline: A man posing as an officer of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) was arrested in Polonnaruwa yesterday.

title: Trump says Putin talks ’don’t go anywhere’ as he imposes new sanctions
byline: The US has announced new sanctions targeting Russia’s two largest oil companies in an effort to pressure Moscow to negotiate a peace deal in Ukraine.

title: Fire at Wadduwa tourist hotel: Guests rescued, one injured
byline: A fire broke out on the second floor of a three-storey tourist hotel in Wadduwa.

title: Preschools to follow single syllabus from 2027: PM
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said yesterday that one islandwide curriculum for all preschools will be introduced from 2027.

title: No arrested underworld figure will die in police custody: Justice Minister
byline: Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara today assured that no underworld figures who were arrested will die in police custody.

title: Another derailment on upcountry line
byline: The night mail train travelling from Badulla Railway Station to Colombo Fort derailed at the Kithelella Sub-Station tonight, the Railways Department said.

title: Diyawadana Nilame election in crisis with lack of male Divisional Secretaries?
byline: Issues pertaining to the election of a Diyawadana Nimale at the Sri Dalada Maligawa, including the non-eligibility of women Divisional Secretaries to vote, is to be discussed in Parliament tomorrow.

title: High-level meeting held to strengthen airport security
byline: A high-level meeting was held today (23 October) at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, jointly chaired by Deputy Minister of Ports and Aviation, Janith Ruwan Kodituwakku and Defence Secretary Sampath Thuyacontha.

title: Shritharan using CC membership to shield himself from bribery allegations: Chamara Sampath
byline: Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath in a privilege issue raised serious concerns over the conduct of MP S. Shritharan, as a member of the Constitutional Council.

title: Don’t become a ghost, you scare us even now: Justice Minister tells Chamara Sampath
byline: Responding to MP Chamara Sampath’s allegations of allegded plans to kill him, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said today the MP will not be killed and assured to protect him.

title: ASPI Rises as Banking Counters Lead Market Rally
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed a mixed trading session today, with the ASPI closing in positive territory, while the S&P SL20 ended marginally lower, reflecting a shift in sectoral momentum.

title: Legal action to be taken over fake education reform bill circulating online
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education has announced that legal action will be taken against those responsible for circulating a fake draft bill on national education reforms for 2026 on social media.

title: Over 700 acres of land in North, East returned to public: Deputy Minister
byline: Over 700 acres of land in the North and the East have been returned to the public, Deputy Minister of Defence Minister Aruna Jayasekera told Parliament today.

title: ’If you kill me, I will haunt you and seek revenge’: Chamara Sampath tells Public Security Minister
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayke, who dropped a bombshell in Parliament, alleged that there was a plan to kill him.

title: Islandwide preschool curriculum to be introduced from 2027: PM
byline: A single national curriculum for all preschools across Sri Lanka will be implemented from 2027, Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya announced yesterday (22).
